title: Pax Americana
summary: Pax Americana[1][2][3] (Latin for "American Peace", modeled after Pax Romana, Pax Mongolica, and Pax Britannica; also called the Long Peace) is a term applied to the concept of relative peace in the Western Hemisphere and later the world after the end of World War II in 1945, when the  United States[4] became the world's dominant economic and military power.
